intro: Chisocheton setosus, commonly known as the hairy chisocheton, is a tropical plant belonging to the family Meliaceae. It is characterized by its compound leaves with serrated edges and small, clustered flowers that are usually greenish-yellow in color. The plant produces small, round fruits that contain several seeds. It is native to Southeast Asia and thrives in humid, tropical climates. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and greenhouses.
